intro: Hieracium valdepilosum subsp. alfenzinum, commonly known as the Alfenzin's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to orange-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has basal and stem leaves that are usually hairy and lanceolate in shape. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
